chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Elizabeth M Hidalgo was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Elizabeth M Hidalgo was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AODA Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle with any alcohol or detectable restricted controlled substances in blood.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall operate motor vehicles only if equipped with IID (period of probation).

Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations, including establishment of a driver safety plan.
Defendant shall attend the Victim Impact Offender Panel.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant granted good time credit.
Defendant may serve in any county where arrangements can be made.

DA Snider present.
Def. present.
Atty. Troy Nielsen present.
Ct. #1 - G plea - def. agrees with 4th OWI w/in 5 years.
Ct. #3 - G plea
Plea questionnaire filed with the Court.
State moves to amend BAC to .199 - court amends BAC.
Court questions def.
Court finds def. waives her rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty of Ct. #1 and Ct. #3.  Ct. #2 is dismissed.
Recommendations by counsel.
Statements by def.
Probation - SW - 3 years - Ct. #1 - to run concurrent with Ct. #3.
Probation - SW - 1 year - Ct. #3 - to run concurrent with Ct. #1.
Conditions:
1.  Ct. #1 - fine $1200.00 + $42.50 blood draw = $2569.50
2.  Ct. #3 - pay costs of the action
3.  def. to provide DNA sample
4.  def. to participate in AODA and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
5.  def. to develop a DSP & be in compliance.
6.  def. to not operate a MV unless authorized by MVD.
7.  def. to operate a MV only if equipped with IID (period of probation).
8.  def. to not operate a MV w/any alcohol or detectable restricted controlled substances in blood.
9.  def. to attend VIP
10.  def. to serve 6 mo co jail (conditional time) - w/good time and w/WR privileges - def. may serve in any county where arrangements can be made - def. to report immediately to jail today - bond revoked.
36 months d. l. revocation
IID for a period of 2 years.
Appeal rights explained to def.
Voter ineligibility restrictions explained to def.
Firearm restrictions explained to def.
